channel.title: Interface?
channel.description: how do i make it if i type a command like ::xwarn *name* it opens an interface for them like a menu

item.title: Interface?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

if(command.startsWith("xwarn") && playerRights => 3) { String theirname = command.substring(8); int theirid = server.playerHandler.getPlayerID(theirname); client theirclient = (client) server.playerHandler.players[theirid]; theirclient.showScreen(); }

[code]
public void showScreen()
{
	//Write the packet that client recognises the interface you want to show them here
}[/code]

Lol I caught an exception that was never going to be thrown from those instructions.
Replace with the ones in this post -.- lel.

Read full topic

item.description:
@delta wrote:

this error

client.java:7352: exception java.io.IOException is never thrown in body of corre
sponding try statement
} catch(IOException ioe_)
^

item.title: Interface?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:8, topic:128339”]what do i write in //Write the packet that client recognises the interface you want to show them here?

showInterface(####);?[/quote]

Sure.
Or you could just write the bytes to the stream.
Either way it’s not direct so the MoparScape Client won’t crash.

Read full topic

item.title: Interface?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“delta, post:6, topic:128339”]i am olan i get this error

client.java:7347: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable thiername
location: class client
int theirid = server.playerHandler.getPlayerID(thiername
);
^
client.java:7612: non-static method showInterface(int) cannot be referenced from
a static context
showInterface(8134);
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

if(command.startsWith("xwarn") && playerRights => 3) { try { String theirname = command.substring(8); int theirid = server.playerHandler.getPlayerID(theirname); client theirclient = (client) server.playerHandler.players[theirid]; theirclient.showScreen(); } catch(IOException ioe_) { ioe_.printStackTrace(); System.out.println("An error occured! Usage: ::xwarn PLAYERNAME"); } }

[code]
public void showScreen()
{
	//Write the packet that client recognises the interface you want to show them here
}[/code]

Referenced a non-static method from a static method.
xD
Also a simple spelling mistake.
Remove the static modifier from method showScreen() and replace the command with the updated one.

Read full topic
